numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I observed the graph.
2. Young women reach out to a parent at least once a day more often than young men.
3. Young women reach out to a parent a few times a week more often than young men.
4. Young women reach out to a parent by sending texts more often than by any other type of communication.
5. Young men reach out to a parent by sending texts more often than by any other type of communication.
6. Visiting in person is the least frequent type of communication for young women.
7. Visiting in person is the least frequent type of communication for young men.
8. Visiting in person has the smallest gap between young women and young men.
9. Men reach out to a parent much less than women.
10. I wonder why men reach out to a parent much less than women.
11. In all categories, young men have a lower percentage than young women.
12. I wonder if there is a reason for this difference.
13. This graph relates to me and my community.
14. I am in college.
15. My peers are in college.
16. I do not have much time to reach out to my parents.
17. My peers do not have much time to reach out to their parents.
18. Many of us are hours away from home.
19. If a person is hours away from home then frequently visiting in person is not possible for the person.
20. Many of us have busy lives.
21. Many of us find it hard to make time to talk to our parents.
22. The headline is: Keeping in Touch: How Often Do Young People Contact Their Parents?
